com.ausregistry.jtoolkit2.se

Class Period

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ausregistry.jtoolkit2.se.Period
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Period
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class models the period element specified in RFC5731, used to specify domain validity periods.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Period(int period)
      A validity period specified in the default unit, years.
      Period(PeriodUnit unit, int period)
      A validity period specified in the given unit.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Element appendPeriod(XMLWriter xmlWriter, org.w3c.dom.Element parent)
      Append an XML representation of this Period instance to the list of child elements of the given parent Element.

    • Method Detail

      • appendPeriod

        public org.w3c.dom.Element appendPeriod(XMLWriter xmlWriter,
                               org.w3c.dom.Element parent)
        Append an XML representation of this Period instance to the list of child elements of the given parent Element. The XMLWriter is used to insert the new Element into the DOM tree in which the parent resides.
        Parameters:
        xmlWriter - The XMLWriter that maintains the DOM tree. The work of creating and inserting the new element is delegated to this object.
        parent - The Element which will parent the new element.
